meanings.definition: To impose a new sentence on someone who has already been sentenced.
meanings.sent1: The judge resentenced the criminal to a longer prison term.
meanings.sent2: The court resentenced the offender after new evidence was presented.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully resentenced the student to extra homework for talking in class.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather resentenced our plans for a picnic to a cozy indoor movie night.
meanings.sent5: The chef resentenced the bland soup with a dash of flavorful spices.

meanings.definition: To give a new sentence to someone who has already received a sentence.
meanings.sent1: The judge resentenced the convict to community service instead of jail time.
meanings.sent2: The parole board resentenced the prisoner to a reduced term for good behavior.
meanings.sent3: The siblings jokingly resentenced each other to silly punishments during their game.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events resentenced our vacation plans to a spontaneous road trip.
meanings.sent5: The artist resentenced the dull painting with vibrant colors, transforming it into a masterpiece.
